title: Web Developer items disappear from menu
content: After update to version 90, Web Developer items all disappear from menu. Have any idea to solve this problem?
creator: myuki

title: Google shopping renders strangely in 90.x
content: In Windows 10 Firefox version 90.x, I see Google shopping missing page parts. Not sure what to call the strip of products, see images. Google Chrome renders the page as expected, and previous Firefox releases looked similar.
creator: asparks1980

title: Text in certain web pages became invisible
content:
In Firefox 90.0.1 (64bit) Windows 10, the text in certain web pages, include the main news page of bbc.com has become completely invisible (no width but they are there).

I have disabled all extensions but the problem is still there. I have also tried turning off graphics acceleration but the problem still persisted.

However, if I start Firefox in Safe Mode then the problem goes away. How should I pin point the cause of the issue?
creator: nibikibaba

title: No se ven los opciones de CERRAR, MINIMIZAR
content: Hola. Con la ultima actualizacion de Firefox en el navegador no se ven las opciones de CERRAR, MINIMIZAR
creator: quc2301

title: Picture-in-Picture
content: I can't stop picture in picture feature. And yes, I've tried options - browsing-disable pic in pic, but it doesn't exist in Firefox 90.0. Also I disabled all forms of picture-in-picture in about:config. AND IT STILL SHOWS UP! Please give me a solution that works!
creator: greenphoenix55

title: Deseo saber cómo hacer para usar los caracteres en "negrita" o en "itálica"
creator: hvazquezponce

title: How to set location of temporarily download files Firefox linux
content:
Under Ubuntu. If an application is set to be the default file handler for a certain type of file, Firefox will allow you to open such a download directly in the application. To do this, it saves the file in a temporary location, and then hands over to the application. The problem is that the location firefox uses under Linux is /tmp and modern snap and flatpak desktop apps are not allowed to see /tmp.

For instance, a .deb file is an installable software package. Ubuntu naturally uses the Software app to handle .deb files. But Software is a sandboxed snap app, and it won't open files in /tmp

The workaround of saving files and opening them from the app works, but it defeats the purpose of having registered file handlers.

And I do not know how to get firefox to save temporary download files somewhere else. I can't find any relevant configuration option.

I tried editing the firefox launcher:

env TMPDIR=/home/tim/tmp_firefox firefox

but it still uses /tmp
creator: timrichardson
